Sentence.sentence: Yet there are doubts whether people watching television, a lean back medium, crave interaction.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The amount spent on interactive advertising on television is still small.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Television advertising could do with a boost.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It's been the year of interactive television advertising for the last ten or twelve years, says Colin Dixon of a digital-media consultancy.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Interactive television advertising, which allows viewers to use their remote controls to click on advertisements, has been pushed for years.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Interactive television advertising will become popular in 10-12 years.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Interactive television advertising is successful when incorporated into situation comedies.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Interactive television advertising has not achieved the anticipated results.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Interactive television advertising has been under debate for the last decade or so.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For years, smartphones, televisions, tablets, laptops and desktops have made  up a huge part of the market and driven innovation.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Agencies often produce alternative ads or commercials that are pre-tested in newspapers, television stations, etc.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: There is no access to television in its rooms.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: What does the woman imply about the low price television sets?
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: I guess you watch the quiz show on television last night
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The 1909 Law did not provide full protection for films and sound recordings nor did it anticipate the need to protect radio and television.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Since 1976 the act has been amended to include computer software and guidelines have been adopted for fair use of television broadcasts
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: "It's been the year of interactive television advertising for the last ten or twelve years", says Colin dixon of a digital-media consultancy.

tele远[引申为电,电从远方来]+vis看+ion表名词→看远方,通过电视看→电视

Sentence.sentence: And I could not understand the news on the television or movies or anything like this.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: Another argument against television is that it replaces reading as a form of entertainment.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: As a result, I've always kept up with the newspapers, faithfully read news magazines and learned to really enjoy books, all of which have been an invaluable help to me in radio and television reporting.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: But according to Anderson, the amount of time spent watching television is not related to reading ability.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: For years researchers have attempted to show that television is dangerous to children.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Hilversum became the media capital of the Netherlands, and Dutch television stars moved into the leafy neighborhoods surrounding the town.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: However, by showing that television promotes none of the dangerous effects as conventionally believed, anderson suggests that television cannot be condemned without considering other influences.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: In no time, she became my feet as I read, and splaying across my stomach as I watched television.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: My color television has given me nothing but a headache.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: One traditional belief about television is that it reduces a child's ability to think and to understand the world.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Television gave another push to the local economy.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: The concert was broadcast live and attracted the largest one night audience in the history of television up to that time.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: The following items are approved for use in residential rooms: electric blankets, hair dryers, personal computers, radios, televisions and dvd players.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: There is also l'enigme sans fin from 1938, works on paper, objects, and projects for stage and screen and selected parts from television programmes reflecting the artist's showman qualities.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: This tip reduces outside noise so that television dialogue is clear and understandable.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Traditional wisdom also has it that heavy television-watching lowers IQ scores and affects school performance.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: TV Ears has helped thousands of people with various degrees of hearing loss hear the television clearly without turning up the volume.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: West said,  "I was inspired while watching a television program showing how sleds might have helped with pyramid construction."
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语四川卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: Yet, people of lower iq tend to be lifelong television viewers.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: While traditional “paid” media – such as television commercials and print advertisements – still play a major role, companies today can exploit many alternative forms of media.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The hardest task that television asks of anyone is to turn the power off after he has turned it on.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The challenge the computer mounts to television thus bears little similarity to one format being replaced by another in the manner of record players being replaced by CD players.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Television is a one-way tap flowing into our homes.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: One reason for the persistence of this pyramid of production is that for the past half-century, much of the world's media culture has been defined by a single medium - television - and television is defined by downloading.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It seems most people would be better off if they could shorten their commutes to work, spend more time with friends and family and less of it watching television .
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: One reason for the persistence of this pyramid of production is that for the  past half-century, much of the world's media culture has been defined by a  single medium - television - and television is defined by downloading.
Sentence.come: 2012年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.come: 2012年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: The Prime Minister set forth the aims of his government in a television broadcast.
sentences.cn: 首相在一次电视讲话中阐明了政府的目标。

sentences.en: Who invented television?
sentences.cn: 是谁发明电视的?

sentences.en: She works in television.
sentences.cn: 她在电视台工作。

sentences.en: She's seeking fame in the world of television.
sentences.cn: 她想在电视界出名。

means.word_mean: 电视系统；电视学；电视广播业 </seg>

jx.jx_en_mean: being broadcast by television; appearing in a television programme
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在电视上播放；上电视节目

entry.def: A television or television set is a piece of electrical equipment consisting of a box with a glass screen on it on which you can watch programmes with pictures and sounds.

example.ex: She turned the television on and flicked around between news programmes.
example.tran: 她打开电视，来回换台看不同的新闻节目。

entry.def: Television is the system of sending pictures and sounds by electrical signals over a distance so that people can receive them on a television in their home.

example.ex: Toy manufacturers began promoting some of their products on television...
example.tran: 玩具制造商开始在电视上推销他们的一些产品。

example.ex: Television is increasingly being transmitted by satellites.
example.tran: 越来越多的电视节目通过卫星进行转播。

entry.def: Television refers to all the programmes that you can watch.

example.ex: I don't have much time to watch very much television.
example.tran: 我没有太多时间可泡在电视上。

entry.def: Television is the business or industry concerned with making programmes and broadcasting them on television.

example.ex: British commercial television has been steadily losing its lead as the most advanced sector of the industry in Europe.
example.tran: 英国商业电视在逐步失去其作为欧洲电视广播业最先进部分的领先地位。

means.word_mean: 1. broadcasting visual images of stationary or moving objects;

sentences.sentence: "she is a star of screen and video"
"Television is a medium because it is neither rare nor well done" - Ernie Kovacs

means.word_mean: 2. a receiver that displays television images;

sentences.sentence: "the British call a tv set a telly"

means.word_mean: 3. a telecommunication system that transmits images of objects (stationary or moving) between distant points

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 20th cent.: from tele- 'at a distance' + vision

sentences.cn: 虽然传统的“付费”媒体——如电视广告、印刷广告等——仍在发挥着主要作用，但时至今日，企业还可以运用许多其他的媒体形式进行宣传。

sentences.cn: 对看电视的人来说，最艰巨的任务仅仅是在电视开机之后关闭它。
sentences.en: The hardest task that television asks of anyone is to turn the power off after he has turned it on.

sentences.cn: 百分之八十以上的家庭都有电视机.
sentences.en: Over eighty percent of all families own a television.

sentences.cn: 旅馆每个房间都有电视机作为额外优待.
sentences.en: Television is available in each of the hotel rooms as an extra.

sentences.cn: 没有任何东西能把孩子们从电视机前诱开.
sentences.en: Nothing will entice the children from television.

sentences.cn: 今晚有什么电视节目？
sentences.en: What's on television tonight?

sentences.cn: 越来越多的电视节目通过卫星进行转播。
sentences.en: Television is increasingly being transmitted by satellites.

sentences.cn: 不管电视节目多好,我们都不要在其结束时鼓掌.
sentences.en: We don't clap at the end a television programme, however good they are.

sentences.cn: 闎BC是 第一家正式授权播送电视节目的公司.
sentences.en: BBC was the first authority in the world to provide a public television in 1936.

sentences.cn: 本周,好莱坞终于向前迈出了一步,推出了两个分别针对电影和电视节目的在线销售系统.
sentences.en: This week it finally stepped forward, touting two systems for selling films and television shows online.

sentences.cn: 到2006年你就可以在你的移动电话上看收到电视节目了.
sentences.en: By 2006 you will be able to watch television on your Nokia phone.

sentences.cn: 你最喜欢什么电视节目?
sentences.en: What is your favourite television programme?

sentences.cn: 电视节目赞助人承担编制节目的费用.
sentences.en: The sponsors of a television program pay the costs program.

sentences.cn: 他希望看到更多新的电视节目,而不是重播的节目.
sentences.en: He wishes to see more new programs instead of repeat on television.

sentences.cn: 十分之九的美国人每天至少看一个电视节目.
sentences.en: Nine out of ten Americans watch at least one television show a day.

sentences.cn: 湖南大众传媒学院的电视节目制作这个专业好不好 啊 ?
sentences.en: Hunan institute of mass media television programme production this major is good?

sentences.cn: 我不喜欢插入录音笑声的电视节目.
sentences.en: I hate television programs broadcast with canned laughter.

sentences.cn: 不过,新的电影与电视节目传播技术出现以后,这些国家的保护屏障开始受到威胁.
sentences.en: But new technologies for distributing movies and television shows now threaten to overwhelm these national barriers.

sentences.cn: 或许CarlSagan可能是因为多次出现在电视节目中被人们铭记.
sentences.en: Perhaps Carl Sagan may best be remembered for his many appearances on television.

sentences.cn: 不过,电视节目终究是娱乐性质的.
sentences.en: But television is about entertainment.

sentences.cn: 闎bc是第一家正式授权播送电视节目的公司.
sentences.en: BBC was the first authority in the world to provide a public television service in 1936.

sentences.cn: 许多观众还通过卫星和有线电视来接受免费电视节目.
sentences.en: Many viewers also receive free television via satellite or cable.

sentences.cn: 那些重复的电视节目我都看腻了.
sentences.en: I'm tired of seeing all these repeats on television.

sentences.cn: 电视节目特别适宜于表现奇幻, 形象化的和具有多方面艺术效果的节目.
sentences.en: Television is particularly suited to fantasy, imagery and multidimensional effects.

sentences.cn: 对于大学教师在合理范围内参与政治电视节目的事情,各界争论不休.
sentences.en: Various argued in favor of reasonable involvement by university instructors in political television programs.

sentences.cn: 维多利亚在她的新片里扮演一位妄自尊大的电视节目主持人.
sentences.en: In her new film, Victoria plays a prima donna television presenter.

sentences.cn: 这地区电视节目的接收情况不能令人满意.
sentences.en: Reception of the television programmes is unsatisfactory here.

sentences.cn: 他们把它拍成了电视节目.
sentences.en: They make it into television shows.

sentences.cn: 他不在场时,将由谁主持播放他的节目 ( 如电视节目 )?
sentences.en: Who will present his show ( eg on television ) while he's away?

sentences.cn: 我认为电视节目的暴力行为太多了.
sentences.en: If you ask me, there's too much violence on television.

sentences.cn: 人们不同水平地受到电视节目的影响.
sentences.en: People are affected to different extents by what they see on television.

sentences.cn: 他们给高中或者大学里面跳舞的伴奏,有时候也给电视节目配乐.
sentences.en: They play for dancers at high school and college and sometime for television program.

sentences.cn: 我不看广告商赞助的电视节目.
sentences.en: I don't watch commercial televisions.

sentences.cn: 白天的电视节目大量依赖肥皂和某些种类的谈话节目.
sentences.en: Daytime television relies heavily on soap operas and certain types of talk shows.

sentences.cn: 他决定在电视业干一番事业.
sentences.en: He decided to pursue a career in television.

sentences.cn: 美国电视业由于害怕得罪人,对于许多事情连碰也不敢碰.
sentences.en: American television respects too many sacred cows.

sentences.cn: 默多克在20年前捍卫消费者的选择,呼吁电视业竞争,可谓正确之举.
sentences.en: Murdoch was right to champion consumer choice and competition in television 20 years ago.

sentences.cn: 美国电视业1982年起对单独的电视节目进行收视率统计.
sentences.en: The American videoland in 1982 carried on the viewing ratio statistics to the independent television program.

sentences.cn: 没有了, 在整个娱乐世界,无论是电影还是电视业可能都没有什么事能让我感到惊讶了.
sentences.en: No, nothing can possibly surprise me in the motion picture and television industry, the entertainment world.

sentences.cn: 再说, 个体摄影师们现在更加受到电视业方面的尊敬.
sentences.en: Furthermore, freelance cameramen are now getting greater respect from the television industry.

sentences.cn: 广播电视业如今也面临同样的困境.
sentences.en: Broadcast television news is struggling too.

sentences.cn: 电视业是一个竞争性极强的行业.
sentences.en: Television is an enormously competitive business.

sentences.cn: 此次交易如果成功, 将帮助李察爵士实现长期以来在电视业的雄心壮志.
sentences.en: If successful, a deal would help Sir Richard ambitions in the television in dustry.

sentences.cn: 一定要做成当今电视业界独树一派的电视剧.
sentences.en: Certainly must make now a television field alone tree school of soap opera.

sentences.cn: 电影业故意无视电视业的侵犯性竞争。
sentences.en: The movie industry had chosen to ignore the encroaching competition of television.

sentences.cn: 布里斯班由于澳大利亚电影和电视业的发展而迅速变成了一个繁荣的都市。
sentences.en: Brisbane has become the boom town for Australian film and television.

sentences.cn: 最近，安娜·福特对她认为阻碍了女性在电视业发展的男性集团进行了猛烈抨击。
sentences.en: Anna Ford recently hit out at the male clique which she believes holds back women in television.

sentences.cn: 这是我投身电视业的初始阶段。
sentences.en: That was the beginning of my life in the television business.
